required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Retrograde Reperfusion Versus Antegrade Liver Transplant Reperfusion
clinical_study.official_title: A Propensity Score Matched Pair Analysis of Retrograde Reperfusion Versus Antegrade Liver Transplant Reperfusion

brief_summary.textblock: A retrospective cohort analysis was performed comparing patients that had intra operative antegrade liver reperfusions versus patients that had retrograde liver perfusion.

detailed_description.textblock: A retrospective cohort analysis was performed comparing patients that had intra operative antegrade liver reperfusions versus patients that had retrograde liver perfusion. Antegrade Reperfusion(ATR) group: after completing the caval replacement or piggy-back, for IVC anastomosis, Portal vein (PV) anastomosis was done with a running suture as normal fashion, then it was followed by the removal the clamps, starting by the supra hepatic VC, followed by the PV clamp and finally the infrahepatic VC. It was followed by arterial anastomosis and the biliary anastomosis (duct-to-duct if possible). Retrograde group (RETR): after completing the piggyback the IVC was declamped immediately and retrograde low pressure reperfusion of the graft with low oxygenated venous blood was established. Central venous pressure was intended to be higher than in 8 mmHg to enable appropriate retrograde reperfusion in the transplanted liver. Significant venous backflow via portal vein appears immediately after declamping. Venous bleeding from the liver except portal backflow was stopped immediately after declamping the venous anastomosis, as appropriate. Portal vein anastomosis was performed using running suture. It was followed by arterial anastomosis and the biliary anastomosis (duct-to-duct if possible). The endpoints are patient survival and graft survival at 1, 3,5, 10 years post liver transplantation in both groups. To adjust for a selection bias, we will perform a propensity score analysis.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From date of transplantation until the date of next transplantation or date of death from any cause, whichever came first, assessed up to 300 months
primary_outcome.description: Average length of time the liver graft remains in a living recipient regardless of function

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of transplantation until the date of death from any cause assessed up to 300 months
secondary_outcome.description: Average length of time a recipient is alive regardless of presence of the second liver

arm_group.description: After completion of the inferior vena cava anastomosis, the clamps were removed to allow retrograde reperfusion of the graft.
After completion of the inferior vena cava anastomosis, the portal vein anastomosis is completed and then the clamps were removed to allow antegrade reperfusion of the graft.

intervention.description: antegrade (forward) or retrograde (backward) blood reperfusion of the liver graft

study_pop.textblock: All patients who have undergone transplantation of the liver at LHSC.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- all liver transplantations between 1 Jan 2002 and 31 Dec 2005
Exclusion Criteria:
- liver retransplantation
- multiorgan transplantation
- ABO incompatible transplantation

patient_data.ipd_description: Study mechanisms and de-identified subject level data will be shared with researchers who contact the principal investigator.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: From the time of publication for 5 years
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: By contacting the PI and with permission of the REB
